name: OllamaCodeReview
description: Complete a Code Review using on-premises hosted Ollama
author: teriansilva

inputs.name: ollama_endpoint
inputs.label: Ollama API Endpoint
inputs.helpMarkDown: The full URL to your Ollama API endpoint. Supports both HTTP and HTTPS. Example: http://localhost:11434/api/chat or https://ollama.yourdomain.com/api/chat

inputs.name: ai_model
inputs.label: Ollama Model
inputs.helpMarkDown:
## Ollama Model Configuration

### Description
Specify the Ollama model to use for code analysis. You can use any model available in your Ollama instance.

### Common Models
- **codellama** - Meta's Code Llama model optimized for code understanding
- **llama3.1** - Latest Llama 3.1 model with strong reasoning capabilities
- **llama3.2** - Llama 3.2 with improved performance
- **deepseek-coder** - Specialized model for code analysis
- **qwen2.5-coder** - Qwen's code-focused model
- **mistral** - Mistral AI's general-purpose model
- **mixtral** - Mixture of experts model with strong performance

### Custom Models
You can enter any custom model name that exists in your Ollama instance. Run `ollama list` on your Ollama server to see available models.

### Default Value
The default model is set to **codellama**.

Choose or enter the model name that best suits your code review requirements.

inputs.name: bugs
inputs.label: Check for bugs
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Specify whether to enable bug checking during the code review process.

- Set to `true` to perform bug checks.
- Set to `false` to skip bug checks.

Bug checking helps identify and address potential issues in the code. Default value is `true`.

inputs.name: performance
inputs.label: Check for performance problems
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Specify whether to include performance checks during the code review process.

- Set to `true` to perform performance checks.
- Set to `false` to skip performance checks.

Enabling performance checks helps identify and address potential performance-related issues in the code. Default value is `true`.

inputs.name: best_practices
inputs.label: Check for missed best practices
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Specify whether to include checks for missed best practices during the code review process.

- Set to `true` to perform best practices checks.
- Set to `false` to skip best practices checks.

Enabling best practices checks helps ensure adherence to coding standards and identifies areas for improvement. Default value is `true`.

inputs.name: file_extensions
inputs.label: File Extensions
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Specify a comma-separated list of file extensions for which you want to perform a code review. This input helps narrow down the scope of the code review to specific file types.

**Example:**
```plaintext
".js,.ts,.css,.html"
```

Make sure to provide the file extensions without spaces after the commas.

inputs.name: file_excludes
inputs.label: Files to exclude
inputs.helpMarkDown:
## Files to Exclude Configuration

### Description
Specify a comma-separated list of file names that should be excluded from code reviews. This is useful for excluding sensitive files or preventing certain files from being reviewed.

### Format
Provide a list of file names separated by commas. For example: `file1.js, file2.py, secret.txt`

### Default Value
If no files are specified, all files will be considered for code review by default.

inputs.name: additional_prompts
inputs.label: Additional Prompts
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Specify additional Open AI prompts as a comma-separated list to enhance the code review process.

- Add multiple prompts separated by commas.
- These prompts will be used in conjunction with the main code review prompts.

**Example:**
```plaintext
Fix variable naming, Ensure consistent indentation, Review error handling approach
```

inputs.name: bearer_token
inputs.label: Bearer Token (Optional)
inputs.helpMarkDown:
## Bearer Token Configuration

### Description
Provide the Bearer token to authenticate with your secured Ollama API endpoint. This token will be sent in the `Authorization: Bearer <token>` header.

**Leave empty if your Ollama endpoint does not require authentication.**

### When to Use
Use this when your Ollama API is exposed through a reverse proxy (like nginx) that requires Bearer token authentication.

### Security Note
Store sensitive tokens as pipeline variables or Azure Key Vault secrets rather than hardcoding them.

### Example
Use `$(OllamaApiToken)` to reference a pipeline variable.
